Sir_Rosevelt:
{{Short description|American electronic dance music group consisting of Zac Brown, Niko Moon, and Ben Simonetti}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = | image = | image_size = | image_upright = | landscape = | alt = | caption = | background = group_or_band | origin = [[Nashville, Tennessee]], U.S. | genre = {{hlist|[[Dance-pop]]|[[Electronic dance music|EDM]]|[[folktronica]]}}{{cite web|url=https://www.allmusic.com/artist/sir-rosevelt-mn0003651018/biography|title=Sir Rosevelt biography|work=Allmusic|accessdate=March 14, 2018}} | years_active = 2016-2018 | spinoff_of = [[Zac Brown Band]] | label = [[Elektra Records|Elektra]] | past_members = {{hlist|[[Zac Brown]]|[[Niko Moon]]|Ben Simonetti}} }} '''Sir Rosevelt''' was an American [[electronic dance music]] group consisting of [[Zac Brown]], [[Niko Moon]], and Ben Simonetti. The group, formed in 2016, has released one album for [[Elektra Records]]. ==History== Zac Brown, lead singer of [[Zac Brown Band]], first announced Sir Rosevelt in 2016. The group's other members are Niko Moon, a frequent co-writer of Brown's, and Ben Simonetti, who provided [[programming (music)|programming]] for several tracks on Zac Brown Band's ''[[Jekyll + Hyde]]'' album. Initially, Brown did not reveal the other members of the group, nor did he provide any press after the release of their first song "Sunday Finest".{{cite magazine|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/country/premieres/hear-zac-browns-mysterious-side-project-sir-rosevelt-w441218|title=Hear Zac Brown's Mysterious Side Project Sir Rosevelt|last=Dunkerley|first=Beville|date=September 20, 2016|magazine=Rolling Stone|accessdate=14 March 2018}} Later in 2016, he announced the other members and released three more tracks.{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/7526468/zac-brown-sir-rosevelt-interview-dance-pop-edm-diplo-skrillex|title=Zac Brown Reveals Diplo & Skrillex-Influenced Dance-Pop Project Sir Rosevelt: Interview|last=Baltin|first=Steve|date=September 30, 2016|magazine=Billboard|accessdate=March 14, 2018}} An album came in December 2017, with the single "Somethin' 'Bout You".{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop/8031079/zac-brown-sir-rosevelt-album-single-something-bout-you-timbaland|title=Zac Brown Announces Sir Rosevelt Album & New Song 'Something 'Bout You'|last=Armstrong|first=Megan|date=November 10, 2017|magazine=Billboard|accessdate=March 14, 2018}} Also preceding the album's release was another teaser track titled "The Bravest" which was used by the German television channel ZDF for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]].{{cite web|url=http://www.nashcountrydaily.com/2017/11/17/zac-browns-new-trio-sir-rosevelt-releases-new-song-the-bravest-listen/|title=Zac Brown's New Trio, Sir Rosevelt, Releases New Song, "The Bravest" [Listen]|last=Casey|first=Jim|date=November 17, 2017|work=Nash Country Daily|accessdate=March 14, 2018}} ==Discography== ===Albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center" |- ! rowspan="2" style="width:10em;"| Title ! rowspan="2"| Album details ! colspan="1"| Peak positions |- style="font-size:smaller;" ! width="65"| [[Heatseekers Albums|US Heat]]
